heaviest_rainfall.status: On 04 January 2025, a record rainfall of 36.8mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  4.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 37.2 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour was the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 04 January 2025, the storm lasted 37.2 hours with a total precipitation of 36.8mm and it reached 4.6mm per hour at times.

storm.status: A storm is in the area.  This is the first such event since 04 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is no cold snap at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 cold snaps, with an average of 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (187°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: To date, the maximum wind gust recorded was 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The highest wind run ever seen was 1754 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph was the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.4 mm), feels like temperature (up 3.8°C), inside temperature (up 1.6°C), and dew point temperature (up 1.9°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 181.3m higher than yesterday, 629.2m higher than the past week, 201.4m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 835m minimum and 3910m maximum, with an average of 2370m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1737.3m and 2570m.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; anticipate mild and comfortable temperatures. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, humidity should not be a concern and near calm conditions. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and bright sunshine will dominate the day. No significant shifts in the weather are expected.
